docs.lead_paragraph: Surgeons, anesthesiologists and obstetricians at France’s private clinics began a strike over fees and insurance premiums, ignoring pleas from the health minister and emergency room doctors worried about treating patients during a relentless heat wave reaching the levels of the 2003 heat wave, when 15,000 people died. Health Minister Xavier Bertrand asked medical students and retired doctors to back up paramedics and emergency physicians in areas the country has put on a heat alert. About 30 people in France have died in the recent heat wave.

headline.print_headline: FRANCE: SURGEONS STRIKE DESPITE HEAT WAVE
